related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* The OS toolbar is not launching correctly in Pieces OS.
* The issue occurs when trying to launch the toolbar from Visual Studio or the desktop app.
* Restarting the computer and launching automatically don't resolve the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* Version 3.0.0 of the Visual Studio plugin has an issue with initialization of the Saved Materials webview.
* An additional issue might be preventing the toolbar from launching.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Hotfix version 3.0.1 of the Visual Studio plugin released to resolve UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 released with changes to port selection for webviews.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is not fully resolved.
* Clicking the system tray icon doesn't launch the toolbar.
* Pieces OS restarts on its own occasionally.
* Further debugging is needed to identify the root cause.

**Next Steps:**

* Schedule a time with Andrea3i to debug the issue and gather more information.
* Run a utility to retrieve the OS error code for further analysis.
* Investigate potential causes like lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, or permission issues.

related_issues.title: Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User @hra42 reported an issue where he was unable to complete onboarding after deleting his local database.
* @hra42 confirmed he closed pOS and PfD, deleted the relevant folders, then restarted pOS and PfD.
* @mark-at-pieces discovered a PERMISSION_DENIED error with cloud services.

**Problems Identified:**

* Onboarding process breaks if local database is deleted and "com.pieces.pfd" folder is not deleted.
* User @hra42 encountered a PERMISSION_DENIED error when trying to use the app.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Deleting the "com.pieces.pfd" folder along with the local database would allow for a successful onboarding process.
* The cause of the `PERMISSION_DENIED` error was not explicitly addressed in the conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Unclear whether the user was able to complete the onboarding process after deleting the additional folder.
* The `PERMISSION_DENIED` error remains unresolved. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation provides a link to existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel.
* @mack-at-pieces mentions the possibility of involving @mark-at-pieces in the conversation.

related_issues.text:
White screen on Windows 11
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Installed it yesterday and it was fine until it's a permanently blank screen today when I launch the Pieces Desktop app.

I reinstalled the entire suite multiple times and it's still the same.

![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/33184869/bfba2d65-0393-4ef6-b8f9-dc958201fe5d)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User jiaweing reported an issue with a blank white screen in the Pieces Desktop Application.
* User ubranch also reported the same issue and shared a screenshot.
* The blank screen issue persisted for both users, even after re-installing the application.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces Desktop Application displays a blank white screen for some users.
* The cause of the issue was not clear.
* Users were unable to use the application due to the white screen.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Developer mack-at-pieces suggested to re-install the latest version (3.1.0) of the application.
* They also provided a link to their calendar for users to schedule a live troubleshooting session.
* User ubranch shared their negative opinion about the application's use of the flutter stack for Windows development.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving onboarding issues:** Many tickets relate to onboarding problems across macOS and Windows. Focus on resolving these to ensure a smooth first-time user experience.

**Investigate and address Pieces OS and plugin integration errors:** Issues with Pieces OS toolbar launch failures, particularly from plugins, are recurring. Allocate resources to debug and resolve these integration problems.

**Improve Claude LLM context handling:** The "Context exceeded" error with Claude LLM, even for short messages, needs immediate attention. Investigate the root cause and implement a fix to ensure reliable LLM usage.

**Address Pieces Desktop app stability on Windows:**  The app crashing on Windows when uploading files is a critical issue. Prioritize debugging and resolving this to prevent user frustration and data loss.

**Gather more information on white screen issue:** While a temporary workaround exists for the blank white screen issue on Windows, further investigation is needed. Request detailed logs and system information from affected users to identify the root cause.

**Review onboarding documentation and user guidance:**  Given the prevalence of onboarding issues, review the documentation and in-app guidance for clarity and completeness. Ensure users have clear instructions on resetting the app and navigating potential issues.

**Consider enhancing error messages and logging:**  Vague error messages like "Something went wrong" make troubleshooting difficult. Improve error messages with specific details and enhance logging to capture relevant information for faster debugging.
